column4: hello everyone, I want to switch from nautilus to something more light like xfe, can someone help me out please?
install xubuntu-desktop
that's xfce4
no I want to use gnome but without nautilus, and not that is not xfce4 that is xfe
xfe= X file explorer
heh. yes, it's in the universe repo
exactly, I've already installed it, but I want to navigate using xfe not nautilus
ok. System-Preferences-Sessions . open that. You'll see nautilus under current session. Click it, then click the remove button. That should stop nautilus from starting
thanks :)
then, setting xfe as something that gets called properly where nautilus would normally be, I have no clue :)
lol, that was exactly what I needed to know \o/
the easiest way to run that would be Alt-F2 , and type xfe
I am very comfortable saying you will not be able to do that. Nautilus is tightly integrated into gnome, xfe is not
gnomefreak, ok thanks I will stick to nautilus, quite frustrating, bye
I understand your point, but the dev's have to choose somewhere :)
gnomefreak, frustrating because I wanted to make it work, I like nautilus I you have at least 512 ram, I have an old thinkpad with 256, sometimes is way tooooooooooooooooooooo slow
see what gnomefreak just said
best solution available in my experience
gnomefreak, that is no a 'fix' at least not what I want to achieve
we know :( . I'd find the developers for xfe, ask them. And if you get good info, add it to the wiki for the next needy one :)
gnomefreak I will keep launching it from the terminal, yep nickrud, if I get some info I will wiki-fy it :)
alt-f2 xfe is faster ;P
